 2|Main crowd monitoring system.
 3|Orchestrates all components for real-time monitoring.
 4|"""
 5|
 6|import time
 7|from typing import List, Optional, Union
 8|
 9|import cv2
 10|import numpy as np
 11|
 12|from calibration import CameraCalibrator
 13|from config import MonitoringConfig, TrackData
 14|from detector import PersonDetector
 15|from logger_config import get_logger
 16|from occupancy import OccupancyGrid
 17|from trackers import DeepSortTracker, SimpleCentroidTracker
 18|from visualizer import MonitorVisualizer
 19|
 20|logger = get_logger(__name__)
 21|
 22|
 23|class CrowdMonitor:
 24| """Enhanced crowd monitoring system with interactive features"""
 25|
 26| def __init__(self, config: MonitoringConfig):
 27| """
 28| Initialize crowd monitor.
 29| 
 30| Args:
 31| config: Monitoring configuration
 32| """
 33| self.config = config
 34|
 35| # Components
 36| self.detector: Optional[PersonDetector] = None
 37| self.calibrator: Optional[CameraCalibrator] = None
 38| self.tracker: Union[SimpleCentroidTracker, DeepSortTracker, None] = None
 39| self.occupancy_grid: Optional[OccupancyGrid] = None
 40| self.visualizer: Optional[MonitorVisualizer] = None
 41|
 42| # Runtime state
 43| self.frame_count = 0
 44| self.last_detection_frame = -1
 45| self.fps_counter = []
 46| self.fps_start_time = time.time()
 47|
 48| # Interactive display modes
 49| self.display_modes = {
 50| '1': 'Raw Camera',
 51| '2': 'Grid Overlay',
 52| '3': 'Detection View',
 53| '4': 'Monitoring View',
 54| '5': 'Split View'
 55| }
 56| self.current_mode = '4' # Start with monitoring view
 57|
 58| # Camera dimensions
 59| self.camera_width = 0
 60| self.camera_height = 0
 61|
 62| # Grid settings
 63| self.original_cell_width = config.cell_width
 64| self.original_cell_height = config.cell_height
 65|
 66| def initialize(self) -> bool:
 67| """
 68| Initialize all components of the monitoring system.
 69| 
 70| Returns:
 71| True if successful, False otherwise
 72| """
 73| try:
 74| logger.info("Initializing Enhanced Crowd Monitoring System...")
 75|
 76| # Initialize detector
 77| self.detector = PersonDetector(self.config)
 78| if not self.detector.load_model():
 79| return False
 80|
 81| # Initialize video capture
 82| cap = self._initialize_video_capture()
 83| if cap is None:
 84| return False
 85|
 86| # Get camera properties
 87| self.camera_width = int(cap.get(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH))
 88| self.camera_height = int(cap.get(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT))
 89| logger.info(f"Camera resolution: {self.camera_width}x{self.camera_height}")
 90|
 91| # Perform calibration
 92| ret, frame = cap.read()
 93| if not ret:
 94| logger.error("Cannot read from video source")
 95| cap.release()
 96| return False
 97|
 98| self.calibrator = CameraCalibrator()
 99| if not self.calibrator.calibrate(frame):
100| cap.release()
101| return False
102|
103| # Initialize occupancy grid
104| self.occupancy_grid = OccupancyGrid(
105| self.config,
106| self.calibrator.geometry_processor,
107| self.calibrator.world_width,
108| self.calibrator.world_height
109| )
110|
111| # Initialize tracker
112| self._initialize_tracker()
113|
114| # Initialize visualizer
115| self.visualizer = MonitorVisualizer(self.config, self.camera_width, self.camera_height)
116|
117| # Show controls
118| self._show_controls()
119|
120| # Start main processing loop
121| self._process_video_stream(cap)
122|
123| cap.release()
124| cv2.destroyAllWindows()
125| return True
126|
127| except Exception as e:
128| logger.error(f"Initialization failed: {e}")
129| return False
130|
131| def _initialize_video_capture(self) -> Optional[cv2.VideoCapture]:
132| """
133| Initialize video capture with fallback support.
134| 
135| Returns:
136| Video capture object or None
137| """
138| try:
139| source = self.config.source
140| if isinstance(source, str) and source.isdigit():
141| source = int(source)
142|
143| logger.info(f"Trying primary camera source: {source}")
144| cap = cv2.VideoCapture(source)
145|
146| if cap.isOpened():
147| cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, 1280)
148| cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, 720)
149| cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FPS, 30)
150| logger.info(f"Connected to camera source: {source}")
151| return cap
152|
153| cap.release()
154|
155| # Try fallback sources
156| if isinstance(source, int):
157| fallback_sources = [i for i in range(3) if i != source]
158| for fallback_source in fallback_sources:
159| logger.info(f"Trying fallback camera source: {fallback_source}")
160| cap = cv2.VideoCapture(fallback_source)
161|
162| if cap.isOpened():
163| cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, 1280)
164| cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, 720)
165| cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FPS, 30)
166| logger.info(f"Connected to fallback camera: {fallback_source}")
167| return cap
168|
169| cap.release()
170|
171| logger.error("No camera sources available")
172| return None
173|
174| except Exception as e:
175| logger.error(f"Failed to initialize video capture: {e}")
176| return None
177|
178| def _initialize_tracker(self):
179| """Initialize the tracking system"""
180| try:
181| # Try DeepSort if enabled
182| if self.config.use_deepsort:
183| try:
184| from trackers import DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE
185| if DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE:
186| logger.info("Initializing DeepSort tracker")
187| self.tracker = DeepSortTracker(
188| max_age=self.config.max_age,
189| n_init=self.config.n_init
190| )
191| return
192| else:
193| logger.warning("DeepSort not available, using simple tracker")
194| except Exception as e:
195| logger.warning(f"Failed to initialize DeepSort: {e}, using simple tracker")
196|
197| # Use simple tracker
198| logger.info("Using simple centroid tracker")
199| self.tracker = SimpleCentroidTracker(
200| max_age=self.config.max_age,
201| distance_threshold=80.0
202| )
203|
204| except Exception as e:
205| logger.error(f"Failed to initialize tracker: {e}")
206| self.tracker = SimpleCentroidTracker(max_age=self.config.max_age)
207|
208| def _show_controls(self):
209| """Display control instructions"""
210| logger.info("\n" + "=" * 60)
211| logger.info("INTERACTIVE CONTROLS:")
212| logger.info("=" * 60)
213| for key, mode in self.display_modes.items():
214| logger.info(f" '{key}' - {mode}")
215| logger.info(" 'q' - Quit")
216| if self.config.enable_screenshots:
217| logger.info(" 's' - Save screenshot")
218| if self.config.enable_grid_adjustment:
219| logger.info(" 'g' - Toggle grid size")
220| logger.info(" 'r' - Reset to original grid")
221| logger.info(" 'f' - Show FPS info")
222| logger.info("=" * 60 + "\n")
223|
224| def _process_video_stream(self, cap: cv2.VideoCapture):
225| """
226| Main video processing loop with interactive controls.
227| 
228| Args:
229| cap: Video capture object
230| """
231| logger.info("Starting interactive video processing loop")
232|
233| last_time = time.time()
234| show_fps = False
235|
236| try:
237| while True:
238| ret, frame = cap.read()
239| if not ret:
240| logger.warning("Failed to read frame, ending processing")
241| break
242|
243| self.frame_count += 1
244| current_time = time.time()
245| dt = current_time - last_time
246| last_time = current_time
247|
248| # Update FPS tracking
249| self.fps_counter.append(current_time)
250| if len(self.fps_counter) > 30:
251| self.fps_counter.pop(0)
252|
253| # Process frame
254| tracks = self._process_frame(frame)
255|
256| # Update occupancy grid (only for monitoring modes)
257| if self.current_mode in ['4', '5']:
258| self.occupancy_grid.update(tracks, dt)
259|
260| # Generate visualization
261| display_frame = self._create_visualization(frame, tracks, show_fps)
262|
263| # Display the frame
264| window_title = f"Enhanced Crowd Monitor - {self.display_modes[self.current_mode]}"
265| cv2.imshow(window_title, display_frame)
266|
267| # Handle user input
268| key = cv2.waitKey(1) & 0xFF
269|
270| if key == ord('q'):
271| logger.info("User requested quit")
272| break
273| elif key in [ord('1'), ord('2'), ord('3'), ord('4'), ord('5')]:
274| self._handle_mode_switch(chr(key))
275| elif key == ord('s') and self.config.enable_screenshots:
276| self._save_screenshot(display_frame)
277| elif key == ord('g') and self.config.enable_grid_adjustment:
278| self._toggle_grid_size()

290| def _process_frame(self, frame: np.ndarray) -> List[TrackData]:

298| List of current tracks

300| detections = []

303| self.last_detection_frame = self.frame_count
304|
305| if self.tracker is not None:
306| tracks = self.tracker.update_tracks(detections, frame)
307| return tracks

310| def _create_visualization(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
311| show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
312| """
313| Create visualization based on current display mode.

325| elif self.current_mode == '2': # Grid Overlay

327| elif self.current_mode == '3': # Detection View
328| return self._create_detection_view(frame, tracks, show_fps)
329| elif self.current_mode == '4': # Monitoring View

331| elif self.current_mode == '5': # Split View

336| def _create_raw_camera_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
337| """Create raw camera view"""

339| self.visualizer.add_basic_info_overlay(view, "Raw Camera", self.fps_counter,

342|
343| def _create_grid_overlay_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
344| """Create camera view with grid overlay"""

347| self.visualizer.add_basic_info_overlay(view, "Grid Overlay", self.fps_counter,
348| self.fps_start_time, show_fps)

350|
351| def _create_detection_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
352| show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
353| """Create detection view with bounding boxes"""
354| view = frame.copy()

357| info_text = f"People detected: {len(tracks)}"
358| cv2.putText(view, info_text, (10, 60), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.7, (0, 255, 0), 2)
359| self.visualizer.add_basic_info_overlay(view, "Detection View", self.fps_counter,
360| self.fps_start_time, show_fps)

362|
363| def _create_monitoring_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
364| show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
365| """Create full monitoring view with all features"""
366| view = frame.copy()
367| self.visualizer.draw_grid_overlay(view, self.calibrator.geometry_processor, self.occupancy_grid)
368| for track in tracks:
369| self.visualizer.draw_track_annotation(view, track, self.occupancy_grid)
370| self.visualizer.draw_cell_occupancy_overlay(view, self.calibrator.geometry_processor,
371| self.occupancy_grid)
372| info_panel = self.visualizer.create_info_panel(
373| view.shape[1], tracks, self.occupancy_grid, self.frame_count,
374| self.display_modes[self.current_mode], self.tracker, self.fps_counter,
375| self.fps_start_time, show_fps
376| )
377| view = np.vstack([view, info_panel])
378| return view
379|
380| def _create_split_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
381| show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
382| """Create split view showing multiple perspectives"""
383| small_height = self.camera_height // 2
384| small_width = self.camera_width // 2
385|
386| raw_small = cv2.resize(self._create_raw_camera_view(frame, False), (small_width, small_height))
387| grid_small = cv2.resize(self._create_grid_overlay_view(frame, False), (small_width, small_height))
388| detection_small = cv2.resize(self._create_detection_view(frame, tracks, False),
389| (small_width, small_height))
390| birdseye_view = self.visualizer.create_birdseye_view(tracks, self.calibrator.geometry_processor,
391| self.occupancy_grid)
392| birdseye_small = cv2.resize(birdseye_view, (small_width, small_height))
393|
394| cv2.putText(raw_small, "RAW CAMERA", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (255, 255, 255), 2)
395| cv2.putText(grid_small, "WITH GRID", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (0, 255, 0), 2)
396| cv2.putText(detection_small, "DETECTION", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (0, 255, 255), 2)
397| cv2.putText(birdseye_small, "BIRD'S EYE", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (255, 0, 255), 2)
398|
399| top_row = np.hstack([raw_small, grid_small])
400| bottom_row = np.hstack([detection_small, birdseye_small])
401| split_frame = np.vstack([top_row, bottom_row])
402|
403| return split_frame

405| def _handle_mode_switch(self, new_mode: str):
406| """Handle display mode switch"""
407| old_mode = self.current_mode
408| self.current_mode = new_mode

410| logger.info(f"Display mode switched from {self.display_modes[old_mode]} to {mode_name}")

415| filename = f"crowd_monitor_{timestamp}.jpg"

419| def _toggle_grid_size(self):
420| """Toggle between different grid sizes"""
421| current_cells = self.occupancy_grid.grid_rows * self.occupancy_grid.grid_cols
422|
423| if current_cells <= 24:
424| new_width = self.original_cell_width * 0.67
425| new_height = self.original_cell_height * 0.67
426| elif current_cells <= 48:
427| new_width = self.original_cell_width * 0.5
428| new_height = self.original_cell_height * 0.5
429| else:
430| new_width = self.original_cell_width
431| new_height = self.original_cell_height
432|
433| self.config.cell_width = new_width
434| self.config.cell_height = new_height
435| self.occupancy_grid.reinitialize(self.calibrator.world_width, self.calibrator.world_height)
436|
437| def _reset_grid_size(self):
438| """Reset grid to original size"""
439| self.config.cell_width = self.original_cell_width
440| self.config.cell_height = self.original_cell_height
441| self.occupancy_grid.reinitialize(self.calibrator.world_width, self.calibrator.world_height)
442| logger.info("Grid reset to original size")

 2|Detection module for person detection using YOLO.
 3|"""
 4|
 5|from pathlib import Path
 6|from typing import List
 7|
 8|import numpy as np
 9|from ultralytics import YOLO
 10|
 11|from config import MonitoringConfig
 12|from logger_config import get_logger
 13|
 14|logger = get_logger(__name__)
 15|
 16|
 17|def download_yolo_model(model_name: str) -> bool:
 18| """
 19| Download YOLO model if it doesn't exist or is corrupted.
 20| 
 21| Args:
 22| model_name: Name/path of the YOLO model
 23| 
 24| Returns:
 25| True if model is available, False otherwise
 26| """
 27| model_path = Path(model_name)
 28|
 29| # Check if model exists and is valid
 30| if model_path.exists():
 31| try:
 32| # Quick validation - check file size
 33| if model_path.stat().st_size > 1000000: # At least 1MB
 34| logger.info(f"Using existing model: {model_name}")
 35| return True
 36| else:
 37| logger.warning(f"Model file {model_name} appears corrupted (too small)")
 38| except Exception as e:
 39| logger.warning(f"Error checking model file: {e}")
 40|
 41| logger.info(f"Downloading YOLO model: {model_name}")
 42|
 43| try:
 44| # Let YOLO handle the download automatically
 45| YOLO(model_name)
 46| logger.info(f"Model {model_name} downloaded successfully")
 47| return True
 48| except Exception as e:
 49| logger.error(f"Failed to download model {model_name}: {e}")
 50| return False
 51|
 52|
 53|class PersonDetector:
 54| """YOLO-based person detector"""
 55|
 56| def __init__(self, config: MonitoringConfig):
 57| """
 58| Initialize person detector.
 59| 
 60| Args:
 61| config: Monitoring configuration
 62| """
 63| self.config = config
 64| self.model = None
 65|
 66| def load_model(self) -> bool:
 67| """
 68| Load YOLO model with error handling.
 69| 
 70| Returns:
 71| True if successful, False otherwise
 72| """
 73| logger.info(f"Loading YOLO model: {self.config.model_path}")
 74|
 75| # Ensure model is available
 76| if not download_yolo_model(self.config.model_path):
 77| logger.error("Failed to download YOLO model")
 78| return False
 79|
 80| # Load the model with error handling
 81| try:
 82| self.model = YOLO(self.config.model_path)
 83| logger.info("YOLO model loaded successfully")
 84| return True
 85| except Exception as e:
 86| logger.error(f"Failed to load YOLO model: {e}")
 87| logger.info("Attempting to re-download model...")
 88|
 89| # Remove corrupted model file
 90| model_path = Path(self.config.model_path)
 91| if model_path.exists():
 92| model_path.unlink()
 93|
 94| # Force re-download
 95| if not download_yolo_model(self.config.model_path):
 96| return False
 97|
 98| try:
 99| self.model = YOLO(self.config.model_path)
100| logger.info("YOLO model loaded successfully after re-download")
101| return True
102| except Exception as e2:
103| logger.error(f"Failed to load YOLO model even after re-download: {e2}")
104| return False
105|
106| def detect_persons(self, frame: np.ndarray) -> List[List[float]]:
107| """
108| Detect persons in the frame using YOLO.
109| 
110| Args:
111| frame: Input frame
112| 
113| Returns:
114| List of detections as [x1, y1, x2, y2, confidence]
115| """
116| if self.model is None:
117| logger.error("Model not loaded")
118| return []
119|
120| try:
121| results = self.model(
122| frame,
123| imgsz=640,
124| conf=self.config.confidence_threshold,
125| classes=[0], # Person class
126| verbose=False
127| )
128|
129| detections = []
130| h_img, w_img = frame.shape[:2]
131|
132| for result in results:
133| if hasattr(result, 'boxes') and result.boxes is not None:
134| for box in result.boxes:
135| try:
136| xyxy = box.xyxy[0].cpu().numpy() if hasattr(box.xyxy[0], 'cpu') else np.array(box.xyxy[0])
137| conf = float(box.conf[0].cpu().numpy()) if hasattr(box.conf[0], 'cpu') else float(
138| box.conf[0])
139| except Exception:
140| continue
141|
142| x1, y1, x2, y2 = map(float, xyxy)
143| x1 = max(0, min(w_img - 1, x1))
144| x2 = max(0, min(w_img - 1, x2))
145| y1 = max(0, min(h_img - 1, y1))
146| y2 = max(0, min(h_img - 1, y2))
147|
148| if x2 <= x1 or y2 <= y1:
149| continue
150|
151| area = (x2 - x1) * (y2 - y1)
152| if area < self.config.min_bbox_area:
153| continue
154|
155| detections.append([x1, y1, x2, y2, conf])
156|
157| logger.debug(f"Detected {len(detections)} persons")
158| return detections
159|
160| except Exception as e:
161| logger.error(f"Detection error: {e}")
162| return []

 21|class MonitorVisualizer:
 22| """Handles all visualization and rendering operations"""
 23|
 24| def __init__(self, config: MonitoringConfig, camera_width: int, camera_height: int):
 25| """
 26| Initialize visualizer.
 27| 
 28| Args:
 29| config: Monitoring configuration
 30| camera_width: Camera frame width
 31| camera_height: Camera frame height
 32| """
 33| self.config = config
 34| self.camera_width = camera_width
 35| self.camera_height = camera_height
 36|
 37| def draw_grid_overlay(self, view: np.ndarray, geometry_processor: GeometryProcessor,
 38| occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid):
 39| """
 40| Draw grid lines on camera view.
 41| 
 42| Args:
 43| view: Image to draw on
 44| geometry_processor: Geometry processor for coordinate conversion
 45| occupancy_grid: Occupancy grid for dimensions
 46| """
 47| grid_color = (100, 255, 100)
 48| thickness = self.config.grid_line_thickness
 49|
 50| for i in range(occupancy_grid.grid_rows + 1):
 51| y_world = i * self.config.cell_height
 52| try:
 53| x1, y1 = geometry_processor.world_to_image_point(0.0, y_world)
 54| x2, y2 = geometry_processor.world_to_image_point(occupancy_grid.world_width, y_world)
 55| cv2.line(view, (x1, y1), (x2, y2), grid_color, thickness)
 56| except Exception:
 57| pass
 58|
 59| for j in range(occupancy_grid.grid_cols + 1):
 60| x_world = j * self.config.cell_width
 61| try:
 62| x1, y1 = geometry_processor.world_to_image_point(x_world, 0.0)
 63| x2, y2 = geometry_processor.world_to_image_point(x_world, occupancy_grid.world_height)
 64| cv2.line(view, (x1, y1), (x2, y2), grid_color, thickness)
 65| except Exception:
 66| pass

 68| def draw_simple_track_annotation(self, view: np.ndarray, track: TrackData):
 69| """
 70| Draw simple track bounding box and ID.
 71| 
 72| Args:
 73| view: Image to draw on
 74| track: Track to visualize
 75| """
 76| x1, y1, x2, y2 = track.bbox
 77| cv2.rectangle(view, (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (0, 255, 0), self.config.bbox_thickness)
 78| id_text = f"ID:{track.track_id}"
 79| text_size = cv2.getTextSize(id_text, cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.7, 2)[0]
 80| cv2.rectangle(view, (x1, y1 - 30), (x1 + text_size[0] + 10, y1), (0, 255, 0), -1)
 81| cv2.putText(view, id_text, (x1 + 5, y1 - 8), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.7, (0, 0, 0), 2)
 82|
 83| def draw_track_annotation(self, view: np.ndarray, track: TrackData, occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid):
 84| """
 85| Draw track bounding box and ID with cell information.
 86| 
 87| Args:
 88| view: Image to draw on
 89| track: Track to visualize

 92| x1, y1, x2, y2 = track.bbox
 93| cv2.rectangle(view, (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (0, 255, 0), self.config.bbox_thickness)

 96| cv2.rectangle(view, (x1, y1 - 30), (x1 + text_size[0] + 10, y1), (0, 255, 0), -1)
 97| cv2.putText(view, id_text, (x1 + 5, y1 - 8), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.7, (0, 0, 0), 2)
 98|
 99| # Draw cell information
100| cell = occupancy_grid.get_cell_for_track(track)
101| if cell is not None:
102| row, col = cell
103| cell_text = f"Cell({row},{col})"
104| cell_size = cv2.getTextSize(cell_text, cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.5, 1)[0]
105| cv2.rectangle(view, (x1, y2 + 5), (x1 + cell_size[0] + 10, y2 + 25), (255, 255, 0), -1)
106| cv2.putText(view, cell_text, (x1 + 5, y2 + 18), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.5, (0, 0, 0), 1)

108| def draw_cell_occupancy_overlay(self, view: np.ndarray, geometry_processor: GeometryProcessor,
109| occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid):
110| """
111| Draw cell occupancy numbers on camera view.
112| 
113| Args:
114| view: Image to draw on
115| geometry_processor: Geometry processor for coordinate conversion
116| occupancy_grid: Occupancy grid with counts
117| """
118| for row in range(occupancy_grid.grid_rows):
119| for col in range(occupancy_grid.grid_cols):
120| cx_world = (col + 0.5) * self.config.cell_width
121| cy_world = (row + 0.5) * self.config.cell_height
122| cx_img, cy_img = geometry_processor.world_to_image_point(cx_world, cy_world)
123|
124| count_val = occupancy_grid.ema_counts[row, col]
125| occupancy_text = f"{count_val:.1f}/{occupancy_grid.cell_capacity}"
126|
127| if count_val > occupancy_grid.cell_capacity:
128| bg_color = (0, 0, 255) # Red for overcapacity
129| text_color = (255, 255, 255)
130| elif count_val > occupancy_grid.cell_capacity * 0.8:
131| bg_color = (0, 165, 255) # Orange for warning
132| text_color = (0, 0, 0)
133| else:
134| bg_color = (0, 255, 0) # Green for normal
135| text_color = (0, 0, 0)
136|
137| text_size = cv2.getTextSize(occupancy_text, cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, 2)[0]
138| padding = 5
139|
140| cv2.rectangle(view,
141| (cx_img - text_size[0] // 2 - padding, cy_img - text_size[1] // 2 - padding),
142| (cx_img + text_size[0] // 2 + padding, cy_img + text_size[1] // 2 + padding + 3),
143| bg_color, -1)
144|
145| cv2.putText(view, occupancy_text,
146| (cx_img - text_size[0] // 2, cy_img + text_size[1] // 2),
147| cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, text_color, 2)

149| def add_basic_info_overlay(self, view: np.ndarray, mode_name: str, fps_counter: list,
150| fps_start_time: float, show_fps: bool):
151| """

157| fps_counter: FPS counter list

162| cv2.rectangle(overlay, (10, 10), (350, 80), (0, 0, 0), -1)
163| cv2.putText(overlay, f"Mode: {mode_name}", (20, 30), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (255, 255, 255), 2)
164| cv2.putText(overlay, f"Resolution: {self.camera_width}x{self.camera_height}", (20, 50),
165| cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.4, (255, 255, 255), 1)

167| if show_fps and len(fps_counter) > 5:
168| elapsed = time.time() - fps_start_time

170| cv2.putText(overlay, f"FPS: {fps:.1f}", (20, 70), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.4, (0, 255, 255), 1)
171|
172| timestamp = time.strftime("%H:%M:%S")
173| cv2.putText(overlay, timestamp, (10, view.shape[0] - 10), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.5, (255, 255, 255), 1)
174| cv2.addWeighted(view, 0.8, overlay, 0.2, 0, view)

176| def create_info_panel(self, width: int, tracks: List[TrackData], occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid,
177| frame_count: int, display_mode: str, tracker, fps_counter: list,
178| fps_start_time: float, show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
179| """
180| Create comprehensive information panel for monitoring view.
181| 
182| Args:
183| width: Panel width
184| tracks: Current tracks
185| occupancy_grid: Occupancy grid

187| display_mode: Current display mode

196| panel_height = 120

199| total_people = len(tracks)
200| total_capacity = occupancy_grid.grid_rows * occupancy_grid.grid_cols * occupancy_grid.cell_capacity
201| alert_count = int(np.sum(occupancy_grid.notified))
202|
203| info_text = (f"People: {total_people} | Capacity: {total_capacity} | "
204| f"Grid: {occupancy_grid.grid_rows}x{occupancy_grid.grid_cols} | "
205| f"Cell: {self.config.cell_width:.1f}x{self.config.cell_height:.1f}m")
206| cv2.putText(panel, info_text, (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (255, 255, 255), 1)
207|
208| if alert_count > 0:

211| else:
212| status_text = "All cells within capacity"
213| cv2.putText(panel, status_text, (10, 50), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (0, 255, 0), 1)
214|
215| perf_text = f"Frame: {frame_count} | Mode: {display_mode}"
216| if show_fps and len(fps_counter) > 5:
217| elapsed = time.time() - fps_start_time
218| fps = len(fps_counter) / max(elapsed, 1)
219| perf_text += f" | FPS: {fps:.1f}"
220| cv2.putText(panel, perf_text, (10, 75), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.5, (180, 180, 180), 1)
221|
222| controls_text = "Controls: 1-5 (modes) | s (screenshot) | g (grid) | r (reset) | f (fps) | q (quit)"
223| cv2.putText(panel, controls_text, (10, 95), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.4, (120, 120, 120), 1)

231| def create_birdseye_view(self, tracks: List[TrackData], geometry_processor: GeometryProcessor,
232| occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid) -> np.ndarray:
233| """
234| Create bird's eye view visualization.

244| scale = min(self.config.max_birdseye_pixels / max(occupancy_grid.world_width,
245| occupancy_grid.world_height), 200.0)

247| view_height = int(occupancy_grid.world_height * scale)

252| self._draw_birdseye_grid(view, scale, occupancy_grid)

260| def _draw_occupancy_heatmap(self, view: np.ndarray, scale: float, occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid):
261| """Draw occupancy heat map on bird's eye view"""
262| overlay = np.zeros_like(view)
263|
264| for row in range(occupancy_grid.grid_rows):
265| for col in range(occupancy_grid.grid_cols):
266| x1 = int(col * self.config.cell_width * scale)
267| y1 = int(row * self.config.cell_height * scale)
268| x2 = int((col + 1) * self.config.cell_width * scale)
269| y2 = int((row + 1) * self.config.cell_height * scale)
270|
271| x1 = max(0, min(view.shape[1] - 1, x1))
272| x2 = max(0, min(view.shape[1], x2))
273| y1 = max(0, min(view.shape[0] - 1, y1))
274| y2 = max(0, min(view.shape[0], y2))
275|
276| if x2 <= x1 or y2 <= y1:
277| continue
278|
279| count = occupancy_grid.ema_counts[row, col]
280| color = self._get_occupancy_color(count, occupancy_grid.cell_capacity)
281| cv2.rectangle(overlay, (x1, y1), (x2, y2), color, -1)
282|
283| cv2.addWeighted(overlay, 0.6, view, 0.4, 0, view)

285| def _get_occupancy_color(self, occupancy: float, cell_capacity: int) -> Tuple[int, int, int]:
286| """Get color for occupancy level"""
287| if occupancy > cell_capacity:
288| intensity = min(255, int(150 + 105 * min(1.0, (occupancy / cell_capacity - 1))))
289| return (0, 0, intensity)
290|
291| fraction = occupancy / max(1.0, cell_capacity)
292|
293| if fraction > 0.8:
294| t = (fraction - 0.8) / 0.2
295| return (0, int(165 + 90 * t), int(255 - 100 * t))
296| elif fraction > 0.5:
297| t = (fraction - 0.5) / 0.3
298| return (int(100 * t), 255, int(100 * t))
299| elif fraction > 0.1:
300| t = (fraction - 0.1) / 0.4
301| return (0, int(80 + 175 * t), 0)
302| else:
303| return (100, 60, 40)
304|
305| def _draw_birdseye_grid(self, view: np.ndarray, scale: float, occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid):
306| """Draw grid lines on bird's eye view"""
307| grid_color = (120, 120, 120)
308|
309| for col in range(occupancy_grid.grid_cols + 1):
310| x = int(col * self.config.cell_width * scale)
311| if 0 <= x < view.shape[1]:
312| cv2.line(view, (x, 0), (x, view.shape[0] - 1), grid_color, 1)
313|
314| for row in range(occupancy_grid.grid_rows + 1):
315| y = int(row * self.config.cell_height * scale)
316| if 0 <= y < view.shape[0]:
317| cv2.line(view, (0, y), (view.shape[1] - 1, y), grid_color, 1)
318|
319| for row in range(occupancy_grid.grid_rows):
320| for col in range(occupancy_grid.grid_cols):
321| center_x = int((col + 0.5) * self.config.cell_width * scale)
322| center_y = int((row + 0.5) * self.config.cell_height * scale)
323|
324| coord_text = f"({row},{col})"
325| cv2.putText(view, coord_text, (center_x - 25, center_y - 10),
326| cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.35, (200, 200, 200), 1)
327|
328| count_text = f"{occupancy_grid.ema_counts[row, col]:.1f}"
329| cv2.putText(view, count_text, (center_x - 15, center_y + 5),
330| cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.4, (255, 255, 255), 1)
331|
332| if occupancy_grid.notified[row, col]:
333| cv2.rectangle(view, (center_x - 20, center_y - 15), (center_x + 20, center_y + 15),
334| (0, 0, 255), 2)

336| def _draw_birdseye_tracks(self, view: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData], scale: float,
337| geometry_processor: GeometryProcessor):
338| """Draw person positions on bird's eye view"""
339| for track in tracks:
340| polygon, _ = geometry_processor.project_bbox_to_world(track.bbox)
341| if polygon is None:
342| continue
343|
344| centroid = polygon.centroid
345| px = int(centroid.x * scale)
346| py = int(centroid.y * scale)
347|
348| if 0 <= px < view.shape[1] and 0 <= py < view.shape[0]:
349| cv2.circle(view, (px, py), 6, (0, 255, 0), -1)
350| cv2.circle(view, (px, py), 6, (255, 255, 255), 1)

352| cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.3, (255, 255, 255), 1)

354| def _create_birdseye_legend(self, width: int, occupancy_grid: OccupancyGrid) -> np.ndarray:
355| """Create legend for bird's eye view"""
356| legend_height = 60
357| legend = np.zeros((legend_height, width, 3), dtype=np.uint8) + 30
358|
359| legend_items = [

361| ("Low", (0, 155, 0)),

366|

369| cv2.rectangle(legend, (x_pos, 15), (x_pos + 15, 30), color, -1)

372| x_pos += 60

380|
381| return legend

 2|Occupancy grid management module.
 3|Handles grid-based crowd density monitoring and alerts.

 6|import math
 7|import time
 8|from typing import List, Optional

 10|import numpy as np

 13|from config import MonitoringConfig, TrackData

 20|class OccupancyGrid:
 21| """Manages occupancy grid for crowd density monitoring"""
 22|
 23| def __init__(self, config: MonitoringConfig, geometry_processor: GeometryProcessor,
 24| world_width: float, world_height: float):
 25| """
 26| Initialize occupancy grid.
 27| 
 28| Args:
 29| config: Monitoring configuration
 30| geometry_processor: Geometry processor for coordinate transforms
 31| world_width: Width of monitored area in meters
 32| world_height: Height of monitored area in meters
 33| """
 34| self.config = config
 35| self.geometry_processor = geometry_processor
 36| self.world_width = world_width
 37| self.world_height = world_height
 38|
 39| # Calculate grid dimensions
 40| self.grid_cols = int(math.ceil(world_width / config.cell_width))
 41| self.grid_rows = int(math.ceil(world_height / config.cell_height))
 42|
 43| # Calculate cell capacity based on person radius
 44| person_area = math.pi * config.person_radius ** 2
 45| cell_area = config.cell_width * config.cell_height
 46| self.cell_capacity = max(1, int(cell_area / person_area))
 47|
 48| # Initialize runtime state arrays
 49| self.ema_counts = np.zeros((self.grid_rows, self.grid_cols), dtype=np.float32)
 50| self.timers = np.zeros((self.grid_rows, self.grid_cols), dtype=np.float32)
 51| self.notified = np.zeros((self.grid_rows, self.grid_cols), dtype=bool)
 52|
 53| logger.info(f"Grid initialized: {self.grid_rows}x{self.grid_cols} cells, "
 54| f"capacity: {self.cell_capacity} per cell")
 55|
 56| def update(self, tracks: List[TrackData], dt: float):
 57| """
 58| Update the occupancy grid with current tracks.
 59| 
 60| Args:
 61| tracks: List of current tracks
 62| dt: Time delta since last update
 63| """
 64| current_counts = np.zeros_like(self.ema_counts)
 65|
 66| for track in tracks:
 67| polygon, _ = self.geometry_processor.project_bbox_to_world(track.bbox)
 68| if polygon is None or polygon.area <= 1e-6:
 69| continue
 70|
 71| minx, miny, maxx, maxy = polygon.bounds
 72| min_col = max(0, int(minx // self.config.cell_width))
 73| max_col = min(self.grid_cols - 1, int(maxx // self.config.cell_width))
 74| min_row = max(0, int(miny // self.config.cell_height))
 75| max_row = min(self.grid_rows - 1, int(maxy // self.config.cell_height))
 76|
 77| for row in range(min_row, max_row + 1):
 78| for col in range(min_col, max_col + 1):
 79| cell_polygon = shapely_box(
 80| col * self.config.cell_width,
 81| row * self.config.cell_height,
 82| (col + 1) * self.config.cell_width,
 83| (row + 1) * self.config.cell_height
 84| )
 85|
 86| try:
 87| intersection = polygon.intersection(cell_polygon)
 88| if not intersection.is_empty:
 89| overlap_fraction = intersection.area / polygon.area
 90| current_counts[row, col] += max(0.0, min(1.0, overlap_fraction))
 91| except Exception:
 92| current_counts[row, col] += 0.1
 93|
 94| # Apply exponential moving average
 95| self.ema_counts = (self.config.ema_alpha * current_counts +
 96| (1.0 - self.config.ema_alpha) * self.ema_counts)
 97|
 98| # Update alerts
 99| self._update_alerts(dt)
100|
101| def _update_alerts(self, dt: float):
102| """
103| Update alert timers and trigger notifications.
104| 
105| Args:
106| dt: Time delta since last update
107| """
108| for row in range(self.grid_rows):
109| for col in range(self.grid_cols):
110| if self.ema_counts[row, col] > self.cell_capacity:
111| self.timers[row, col] += dt
112| else:
113| self.timers[row, col] = max(0.0, self.timers[row, col] - dt)
114|
115| if (self.timers[row, col] >= self.config.hysteresis_time and
116| not self.notified[row, col]):
117| timestamp = time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
118| logger.warning(
119| f"OVERCAPACITY ALERT - Cell ({row},{col}) "
120| f"occupancy: {self.ema_counts[row, col]:.2f}/{self.cell_capacity} "
121| f"at {timestamp}"
122| )
123| self.notified[row, col] = True
124|
125| if (self.notified[row, col] and
126| self.ema_counts[row, col] <= max(0, self.cell_capacity - 0.5)):
127| logger.info(f"Alert cleared for cell ({row},{col})")
128| self.notified[row, col] = False
129|
130| def get_cell_for_track(self, track: TrackData) -> Optional[tuple]:
131| """
132| Get grid cell coordinates for a track.
133| 
134| Args:
135| track: Track to locate
136| 
137| Returns:
138| Tuple of (row, col) or None
139| """
140| polygon, _ = self.geometry_processor.project_bbox_to_world(track.bbox)
141| if polygon is None:
142| return None
143|
144| centroid = polygon.centroid
145| col = int(centroid.x // self.config.cell_width)
146| row = int(centroid.y // self.config.cell_height)
147|
148| if 0 <= row < self.grid_rows and 0 <= col < self.grid_cols:
149| return (row, col)
150| return None
151|
152| def reinitialize(self, world_width: float, world_height: float):
153| """
154| Reinitialize grid with new dimensions.
155| 
156| Args:
157| world_width: New world width in meters
158| world_height: New world height in meters
159| """
160| self.world_width = world_width
161| self.world_height = world_height
162|
163| # Recalculate grid dimensions
164| self.grid_cols = int(math.ceil(world_width / self.config.cell_width))
165| self.grid_rows = int(math.ceil(world_height / self.config.cell_height))
166|
167| # Recalculate cell capacity
168| person_area = math.pi * self.config.person_radius ** 2
169| cell_area = self.config.cell_width * self.config.cell_height
170| self.cell_capacity = max(1, int(cell_area / person_area))
171|
172| # Reinitialize runtime state arrays
173| self.ema_counts = np.zeros((self.grid_rows, self.grid_cols), dtype=np.float32)
174| self.timers = np.zeros((self.grid_rows, self.grid_cols), dtype=np.float32)
175| self.notified = np.zeros((self.grid_rows, self.grid_cols), dtype=bool)
176|
177| logger.info(f"Grid reinitialized: {self.grid_rows}x{self.grid_cols} cells")

 2|Tracking module for person tracking across frames.
 3|Supports both simple centroid tracking and DeepSort.
 4|"""
 5|
 6|import math
 7|from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
 8|
 9|import numpy as np
 10|
 11|from config import TrackData
 12|from logger_config import get_logger
 13|
 14|logger = get_logger(__name__)
 15|
 16|# Import DeepSort with comprehensive error handling
 17|try:
 18| from deep_sort_realtime.deepsort_tracker import DeepSort
 19|
 20| DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE = True
 21| logger.info("DeepSort successfully imported")
 22|except ImportError as e:
 23| logger.warning(f"DeepSort not available: {e}")
 24| logger.info("Install with: pip install deep-sort-realtime")
 25| DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE = False
 26| DeepSort = None
 27|
 28|
 29|class SimpleCentroidTracker:
 30| """Optimized centroid-based tracker with better performance"""
 31|
 32| def __init__(self, max_age: int = 30, distance_threshold: float = 80.0):
 33| """
 34| Initialize simple centroid tracker.
 35| 
 36| Args:
 37| max_age: Maximum frames to keep track without detection
 38| distance_threshold: Maximum distance for track-detection matching
 39| """
 40| self.next_id = 1
 41| self.tracks: Dict[int, TrackData] = {}
 42| self.max_age = max_age
 43| self.distance_threshold = distance_threshold
 44|
 45| def update_tracks(self, detections: List[List[float]], frame: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> List[TrackData]:
 46| """
 47| Update tracks with new detections using optimized algorithm.
 48| 
 49| Args:
 50| detections: List of detections as [x1, y1, x2, y2, confidence]
 51| frame: Optional frame for appearance-based tracking (unused in centroid)
 52| 
 53| Returns:
 54| List of current TrackData objects
 55| """
 56| if not detections:
 57| self._age_tracks()
 58| return list(self.tracks.values())
 59|
 60| # Extract centroids efficiently
 61| centroids = [(det, (det[0] + det[2]) / 2, (det[1] + det[3]) / 2)
 62| for det in detections if len(det) >= 4]
 63|
 64| if not self.tracks:
 65| # Initialize tracks for first frame
 66| self._create_initial_tracks(centroids)
 67| else:
 68| # Match existing tracks to detections
 69| self._match_tracks_to_detections(centroids)
 70|
 71| self._remove_old_tracks()
 72| return list(self.tracks.values())
 73|
 74| def _create_initial_tracks(self, centroids: List[Tuple[List[float], float, float]]):
 75| """Create initial tracks for first frame"""
 76| for det, cx, cy in centroids:
 77| self.tracks[self.next_id] = TrackData(
 78| track_id=self.next_id,
 79| bbox=(int(det[0]), int(det[1]), int(det[2]), int(det[3])),
 80| world_position=(cx, cy),
 81| confidence=det[4] if len(det) > 4 else 1.0
 82| )
 83| self.next_id += 1
 84|
 85| def _match_tracks_to_detections(self, centroids: List[Tuple[List[float], float, float]]):
 86| """Match existing tracks to new detections using greedy algorithm"""
 87| used_detections = set()
 88|
 89| # Simple greedy matching - could be improved with Hungarian algorithm
 90| for track_id, track in list(self.tracks.items()):
 91| best_match = None
 92| best_distance = float('inf')
 93|
 94| for i, (det, cx, cy) in enumerate(centroids):
 95| if i in used_detections:
 96| continue
 97|
 98| # Calculate Euclidean distance
 99| distance = math.sqrt(
100| (track.world_position[0] - cx) ** 2 +
101| (track.world_position[1] - cy) ** 2
102| )
103|
104| if distance < best_distance and distance < self.distance_threshold:
105| best_distance = distance
106| best_match = (i, det, cx, cy)
107|
108| if best_match:
109| i, det, cx, cy = best_match
110| used_detections.add(i)
111|
112| # Update track
113| track.bbox = (int(det[0]), int(det[1]), int(det[2]), int(det[3]))
114| track.world_position = (cx, cy)
115| track.confidence = det[4] if len(det) > 4 else 1.0
116| track.age = 0
117| else:
118| track.age += 1
119|
120| # Create new tracks for unmatched detections
121| for i, (det, cx, cy) in enumerate(centroids):
122| if i not in used_detections:
123| self.tracks[self.next_id] = TrackData(
124| track_id=self.next_id,
125| bbox=(int(det[0]), int(det[1]), int(det[2]), int(det[3])),
126| world_position=(cx, cy),
127| confidence=det[4] if len(det) > 4 else 1.0
128| )
129| self.next_id += 1
130|
131| def _age_tracks(self):
132| """Age all tracks when no detections are available"""
133| for track in self.tracks.values():
134| track.age += 1
135|
136| def _remove_old_tracks(self):
137| """Remove tracks that are too old"""
138| expired_tracks = [track_id for track_id, track in self.tracks.items()
139| if track.age > self.max_age]
140| for track_id in expired_tracks:
141| del self.tracks[track_id]
142|
143|
144|class DeepSortTracker:
145| """Wrapper for DeepSort tracker with error handling"""
146|
147| def __init__(self, max_age: int = 30, n_init: int = 1):
148| """
149| Initialize DeepSort tracker.
150| 
151| Args:
152| max_age: Maximum frames to keep track without detection
153| n_init: Number of consecutive detections to confirm track
154| """
155| if not DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE:
156| raise ImportError("DeepSort is not available")
157|
158| try:
159| self.tracker = DeepSort(max_age=max_age, n_init=n_init)
160| logger.info("DeepSort tracker initialized successfully")
161| except Exception as e:
162| logger.error(f"Failed to initialize DeepSort: {e}")
163| raise
164|
165| def update_tracks(self, detections: List[List[float]], frame: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> List[TrackData]:
166| """
167| Update tracks using DeepSort.
168| 
169| Args:
170| detections: List of detections as [x1, y1, x2, y2, confidence]
171| frame: Frame image for appearance feature extraction
172| 
173| Returns:
174| List of current TrackData objects
175| """
176| try:
177| if not detections:
178| tracks = self.tracker.update_tracks([], frame=frame)
179| else:
180| # Format detections for DeepSort (x, y, w, h, confidence)
181| formatted_detections = []
182| for det in detections:
183| if len(det) >= 4:
184| x1, y1, x2, y2 = det[:4]
185| w, h = x2 - x1, y2 - y1
186| conf = det[4] if len(det) > 4 else 0.9
187| if w > 0 and h > 0:
188| formatted_detections.append([float(x1), float(y1), float(w), float(h), float(conf)])
189|
190| tracks = self.tracker.update_tracks(formatted_detections, frame=frame)
191|
192| # Convert to TrackData format
193| track_data_list = []
194| for track in tracks:
195| if hasattr(track, 'is_confirmed') and not track.is_confirmed():
196| continue
197|
198| track_id = getattr(track, 'track_id', None)
199| if track_id is None:
200| continue
201|
202| # Get bounding box
203| bbox = self._extract_bbox(track)
204| if bbox is None:
205| continue
206|
207| x1, y1, x2, y2 = bbox
208| cx, cy = (x1 + x2) / 2, (y1 + y2) / 2
209|
210| track_data_list.append(TrackData(
211| track_id=track_id,
212| bbox=bbox,
213| world_position=(cx, cy),
214| confidence=1.0
215| ))
216|
217| return track_data_list
218|
219| except Exception as e:
220| logger.error(f"DeepSort tracking error: {e}")
221| return []
222|
223| def _extract_bbox(self, track) -> Optional[Tuple[int, int, int, int]]:
224| """Extract bounding box from track object"""
225| try:
226| if hasattr(track, 'to_tlbr'):
227| tlbr = track.to_tlbr()
228| return int(tlbr[0]), int(tlbr[1]), int(tlbr[2]), int(tlbr[3])
229| elif hasattr(track, 'to_ltrb'):
230| ltrb = track.to_ltrb()
231| return int(ltrb[0]), int(ltrb[1]), int(ltrb[2]), int(ltrb[3])
232| elif hasattr(track, 'to_ltwh'):

 23| self.world_width = 0.0

 26| def calibrate(self, frame: np.ndarray) -> bool:

 30| Args:
 31| frame: Calibration frame
 32| 
 33| Returns:
 34| True if successful, False otherwise
 35| """
 36| try:
 37| logger.info("Starting camera calibration...")

 51| dtype=np.float32)

 54| inv_H_matrix = cv2.getPerspectiveTransform(pts_world, pts_img)

 57| self.world_width = world_width

 61| return True
 62|
 63| except Exception as e:

 67| def _get_calibration_points(self, frame: np.ndarray) -> Optional[np.ndarray]:

117| y_pos = 30

120| cv2.putText(display_frame, instruction, (15, y_pos),
121| cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (0, 255, 0), 2)
122| y_pos += 35
123|
124| cv2.imshow(window_name, display_frame)
125| key = cv2.waitKey(1) & 0xFF
126|

128| break
129| elif key == 27: # ESC key

131| cv2.destroyWindow(window_name)
132| return None
133|
134| cv2.destroyWindow(window_name)
135|
136| if len(clicked_points) >= 4:

138|
139| except Exception as e:
140| logger.warning(f"GUI calibration failed: {e}")
141|
142| # Fallback to manual entry

144|
145| def _manual_calibration_entry(self, frame: np.ndarray) -> Optional[np.ndarray]:
146| """
147| Fallback manual calibration point entry.

 2|Geometry processing module for coordinate transformations.
 3|Handles conversions between image and world coordinates.
 4|"""
 5|
 6|from typing import Optional, Tuple
 7|
 8|import cv2
 9|import numpy as np
10|from shapely.geometry import Polygon
11|
12|from logger_config import get_logger
13|
14|logger = get_logger(__name__)
15|
16|
17|class GeometryProcessor:
18| """Handles geometric transformations and calculations"""
19|
20| def __init__(self, homography_matrix: np.ndarray, inverse_homography: np.ndarray):
21| """
22| Initialize geometry processor with transformation matrices.
23| 
24| Args:
25| homography_matrix: Matrix to transform from image to world coordinates
26| inverse_homography: Matrix to transform from world to image coordinates
27| """
28| self.H_matrix = homography_matrix
29| self.inv_H_matrix = inverse_homography
30|
31| def project_bbox_to_world(self, bbox: Tuple[int, int, int, int]) -> Tuple[Optional[Polygon], Optional[np.ndarray]]:
32| """
33| Project bounding box from image coordinates to world coordinates.
34| 
35| Args:
36| bbox: Bounding box as (x1, y1, x2, y2) in image coordinates
37| 
38| Returns:
39| Tuple of (Polygon in world coords, corner points in world coords)
40| """
41| try:
42| x1, y1, x2, y2 = bbox
43| corners = np.array([[[x1, y1], [x2, y1], [x2, y2], [x1, y2]]], dtype=np.float32)
44| world_points = cv2.perspectiveTransform(corners, self.H_matrix)[0]
45|
46| polygon = Polygon([(float(p[0]), float(p[1])) for p in world_points])
47| return polygon, world_points
48| except Exception as e:
49| logger.warning(f"Failed to project bbox to world: {e}")
50| return None, None
51|
52| def world_to_image_point(self, world_x: float, world_y: float) -> Tuple[int, int]:
53| """
54| Convert world coordinates to image coordinates.
55| 
56| Args:
57| world_x: X coordinate in world space (meters)
58| world_y: Y coordinate in world space (meters)
59| 
60| Returns:
61| Tuple of (x, y) in image coordinates (pixels)
62| """
63| try:
64| point = np.array([[[float(world_x), float(world_y)]]], dtype=np.float32)
65| image_point = cv2.perspectiveTransform(point, self.inv_H_matrix)[0, 0]
66| return int(image_point[0]), int(image_point[1])
67| except Exception as e:
68| logger.warning(f"Failed to convert world to image point: {e}")
69| return 0, 0

"},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let me create a comprehensive documentation file explaining all the new configuration options:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_01JFLgE1N4yQ4K7wRHeogNoY","type":"function","function":{"name":"write","arguments":"{"file_path": "E:/Stampede-Management/CONFIG_REFERENCE.md", "content": "# Configuration Reference Guide\n\nThis document provides a comprehensive reference for all configuration parameters in the Enhanced Crowd Monitoring System.\n\n## Overview\n\nAll configuration parameters are centralized in the `MonitoringConfig` dataclass in `config.py`. This allows for complete control over the system's behavior, appearance, and performance characteristics.\n\n## Configuration Sections\n\n### 1. Video Source Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `source` | `Union[str, int]` | `\"0\"` | Video source: camera index (0, 1, 2...) or path to video file |\n| `model_path` | `str` | `\"model/yolov8n.pt\"` | Path to YOLO model file |\n| `camera_width` | `int` | `1280` | Camera capture width in pixels |\n| `camera_height` | `int` | `720` | Camera capture height in pixels |\n| `camera_fps` | `int` | `30` | Camera capture frame rate |\n\n**Usage Example:**\n```python\nconfig = MonitoringConfig(\n source=0, # Use first camera\n camera_width=1920,\n camera_height=1080,\n camera_fps=60\n)\n```\n\n---\n\n### 2. Grid and Spatial Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `cell_width` | `float` | `1.0` | Grid cell width in meters |\n| `cell_height` | `float` | `1.0` | Grid cell height in meters |\n| `person_radius` | `float` | `2.0` | Person radius for capacity calculation (meters) |\n\n**Usage Example:**\n```python\nconfig = MonitoringConfig(\n cell_width=2.0, # 2 meter cells\n cell_height=2.0,\n person_radius=0.5 # Smaller radius = higher capacity per cell\n)\n```\n\n---\n\n### 3. Detection Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `detect_every` | `int` | `5` | Run detection every N frames (1 = every frame) |\n| `confidence_threshold` | `float` | `0.35` | Minimum detection confidence (0.0 to 1.0) |\n| `min_bbox_area` | `int` | `1500` | Minimum bounding box area in pixels |\n| `yolo_imgsz` | `int` | `640` | YOLO model input image size |\n| `yolo_classes` | `Tuple[int, ...]` | `(0,)` | YOLO classes to detect (0 = person) |\n| `min_model_size_bytes` | `int` | `1000000` | Minimum valid model file size |\n\n**Usage Example:**\n```python\nconfig = MonitoringConfig(\n detect_every=3, # Detect every 3 frames (faster)\n confidence_threshold=0.5, # Higher threshold = fewer false positives\n yolo_imgsz=1280 # Larger size = better accuracy but slower\n)\n```\n\n---\n\n### 4. Tracking Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `use_deepsort` | `bool` | `False` | Use DeepSort tracker (requires installation) |\n| `max_age` | `int` | `80` | Maximum frames to keep track without detection |\n| `n_init` | `int` | `1` | Consecutive detections to confirm track (DeepSort) |\n| `centroid_distance_threshold` | `float` | `80.0` | Max distance for track matching (pixels) |\n\n**Usage Example:**\n```python\nconfig = MonitoringConfig(\n use_deepsort=True,\n max_age=50,\n n_init=3, # More conservative track confirmation\n centroid_distance_threshold=100.0 # More lenient matching\n)\n```\n\n---\n\n### 5. Smoothing and Alert Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `ema_alpha` | `float` | `0.4` | EMA smoothing factor (0.0 to 1.0) |\n| `fps` | `float` | `15.0` | Expected FPS for timing calculations |\n| `hysteresis_time` | `float` | `3.0` | Alert hysteresis time in seconds |\n| `alert_clear_offset` | `float` | `0.5` | Occupancy drop below capacity to clear alert |\n\n**Usage Example:**\n```python\nconfig = MonitoringConfig(\n ema_alpha=0.3, # More smoothing (slower response)\n hysteresis_time=5.0, # Longer wait before triggering alert\n alert_clear_offset=1.0 # Need 1 person below capacity to clear\n)\n```\n\n---\n\n### 6. Visualization Settings - Basic\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `max_birdseye_pixels` | `int` | `900` | Maximum bird's eye view dimension |\n| `grid_line_thickness` | `int` | `2` | Grid line thickness in pixels |\n| `bbox_thickness` | `int` | `3` | Bounding box thickness in pixels |\n\n---\n\n### 7. Visualization Settings - Colors\n\nAll colors are in BGR format (OpenCV standard).\n\n#### Main View Colors\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default (BGR) | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------------|-------------|\n| `grid_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(100, 255, 100)` | Grid line color (green) |\n| `bbox_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 255, 0)` | Bounding box color (green) |\n| `track_id_bg_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 255, 0)` | Track ID background (green) |\n| `track_id_text_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 0)` | Track ID text (black) |\n| `cell_label_bg_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(255, 255, 0)` | Cell label background (yellow) |\n| `cell_label_text_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 0)` | Cell label text (black) |\n\n#### Occupancy Level Colors\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default (BGR) | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------------|-------------|\n| `occupancy_normal_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 255, 0)` | Normal occupancy (green) |\n| `occupancy_warning_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 165, 255)` | Warning level (orange) |\n| `occupancy_critical_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 255)` | Overcapacity (red) |\n| `occupancy_normal_text_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 0)` | Text for normal/warning (black) |\n| `occupancy_critical_text_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(255, 255, 255)` | Text for critical (white) |\n| `occupancy_warning_threshold` | `float` | `0.8` | Warning at 80% capacity |\n\n**Usage Example:**\n```python\nconfig = MonitoringConfig(\n grid_color=(255, 0, 0), # Blue grid\n bbox_color=(0, 0, 255), # Red bounding boxes\n occupancy_warning_threshold=0.7 # Earlier warning at 70%\n)\n```\n\n---\n\n### 8. Bird's Eye View Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `birdseye_background_value` | `int` | `40` | Background gray level (0-255) |\n| `birdseye_max_scale_fallback` | `float` | `200.0` | Maximum scale if size calculation fails |\n| `birdseye_person_radius` | `int` | `6` | Person dot radius in pixels |\n| `birdseye_person_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 255, 0)` | Person dot color (green) |\n| `birdseye_person_outline_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(255, 255, 255)` | Person outline (white) |\n| `birdseye_grid_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(120, 120, 120)` | Grid color (gray) |\n| `birdseye_alert_box_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 255)` | Alert box (red) |\n| `birdseye_overlay_alpha` | `float` | `0.6` | Heatmap overlay transparency |\n\n---\n\n### 9. UI Panel Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `info_panel_height` | `int` | `120` | Information panel height in pixels |\n| `info_panel_background_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 0)` | Panel background (black) |\n| `info_overlay_alpha` | `float` | `0.2` | Info overlay transparency |\n| `info_overlay_bg_color` | `Tuple[int, int, int]` | `(0, 0, 0)` | Overlay background (black) |\n\n---\n\n### 10. Font Settings\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `font_size_large` | `float` | `0.8` | Large text size |\n| `font_size_medium` | `float` | `0.6` | Medium text size |\n| `font_size_small` | `float` | `0.5` | Small text size |\n| `font_size_tiny` | `float` | `0.4` | Tiny text size |\n| `font_size_birdseye` | `float` | `0.35` | Bird's eye view text size |\n\n---\n\n### 11. Interactive Features\n\n| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |\n|-----------|------|---------|-------------|\n| `enable_screenshots` | `bool` | `True` | Enable screenshot saving (S key) |\n| `enable_grid_adjustment` | `bool` | `True` | Enable runtime grid adjustment (G key) |\n| `grid_toggle_multipliers` | `Tuple[float, ...]` | `(1.0, 0.67, 0.5)` | Grid size multipliers for toggling |\n| `grid_toggle_cell_thresholds` | `Tuple[int, ...]` | `(24, 48)` | Cell count thresholds for toggling |\n| `fps_counter_window` | `int` | `30` | Frames to average for FPS calculation |\n| `split_view_divisor` | `int` | `2` | Division factor for split view layout |\n\n---\n\n### 12.  2Main crowd monitoring system.
 3Orchestrates all components for real-time monitoring.
 4"""
 5
 6import time
 7from typing import List, Optional, Union
 8
 9import cv2
 10import numpy as np
 11
 12from calibration import CameraCalibrator
 13from config import MonitoringConfig, TrackData
 14from detector import PersonDetector
 15from logger_config import get_logger
 16from occupancy import OccupancyGrid
 17from trackers import DeepSortTracker, SimpleCentroidTracker
 18from visualizer import MonitorVisualizer
 19
 20logger = get_logger(__name__)
 21
 22
 23class CrowdMonitor:
 24 """Enhanced crowd monitoring system with interactive features"""
 25
 26 def __init__(self, config: MonitoringConfig):
 27 """
 28 Initialize crowd monitor.
 29 
 30 Args:
 31 config: Monitoring configuration
 32 """
 33 self.config = config
 34
 35 # Components
 36 self.detector: Optional[PersonDetector] = None
 37 self.calibrator: Optional[CameraCalibrator] = None
 38 self.tracker: Union[SimpleCentroidTracker, DeepSortTracker, None] = None
 39 self.occupancy_grid: Optional[OccupancyGrid] = None
 40 self.visualizer: Optional[MonitorVisualizer] = None
 41
 42 # Runtime state
 43 self.frame_count = 0
 44 self.last_detection_frame = -1
 45 self.fps_counter = []
 46 self.fps_start_time = time.time()
 47
 48 # Interactive display modes
 49 self.display_modes = {
 50 '1': 'Raw Camera',
 51 '2': 'Grid Overlay',
 52 '3': 'Detection View',
 53 '4': 'Monitoring View',
 54 '5': 'Split View'
 55 }
 56 self.current_mode = '4' # Start with monitoring view
 57
 58 # Camera dimensions
 59 self.camera_width = 0
 60 self.camera_height = 0
 61
 62 # Grid settings
 63 self.original_cell_width = config.cell_width
 64 self.original_cell_height = config.cell_height
 65
 66 def initialize(self) -> bool:
 67 """
 68 Initialize all components of the monitoring system.
 69 
 70 Returns:
 71 True if successful, False otherwise
 72 """
 73 try:
 74 logger.info("Initializing Enhanced Crowd Monitoring System...")
 75
 76 # Initialize detector
 77 self.detector = PersonDetector(self.config)
 78 if not self.detector.load_model():
 79 return False
 80
 81 # Initialize video capture
 82 cap = self._initialize_video_capture()
 83 if cap is None:
 84 return False
 85
 86 # Get camera properties
 87 self.camera_width = int(cap.get(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH))
 88 self.camera_height = int(cap.get(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT))
 89 logger.info(f"Camera resolution: {self.camera_width}x{self.camera_height}")
 90
 91 # Perform calibration
 92 ret, frame = cap.read()
 93 if not ret:
 94 logger.error("Cannot read from video source")
 95 cap.release()
 96 return False
 97
 98 self.calibrator = CameraCalibrator(self.config)
 99 if not self.calibrator.calibrate(frame):
100 cap.release()
101 return False
102
103 # Initialize occupancy grid
104 self.occupancy_grid = OccupancyGrid(
105 self.config,
106 self.calibrator.geometry_processor,
107 self.calibrator.world_width,
108 self.calibrator.world_height
109 )
110
111 # Initialize tracker
112 self._initialize_tracker()
113
114 # Initialize visualizer
115 self.visualizer = MonitorVisualizer(self.config, self.camera_width, self.camera_height)
116
117 # Show controls
118 self._show_controls()
119
120 # Start main processing loop
121 self._process_video_stream(cap)
122
123 cap.release()
124 cv2.destroyAllWindows()
125 return True
126
127 except Exception as e:
128 logger.error(f"Initialization failed: {e}")
129 return False
130
131 def _initialize_video_capture(self) -> Optional[cv2.VideoCapture]:
132 """
133 Initialize video capture with fallback support.
134 
135 Returns:
136 Video capture object or None
137 """
138 try:
139 source = self.config.source
140 if isinstance(source, str) and source.isdigit():
141 source = int(source)
142
143 logger.info(f"Trying primary camera source: {source}")
144 cap = cv2.VideoCapture(source)
145
146 if cap.isOpened():
147 cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, self.config.camera_width)
148 cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, self.config.camera_height)
149 cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FPS, self.config.camera_fps)
150 logger.info(f"Connected to camera source: {source}")
151 return cap
152
153 cap.release()
154
155 # Try fallback sources
156 if isinstance(source, int):
157 fallback_sources = [i for i in range(3) if i != source]
158 for fallback_source in fallback_sources:
159 logger.info(f"Trying fallback camera source: {fallback_source}")
160 cap = cv2.VideoCapture(fallback_source)
161
162 if cap.isOpened():
163 cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, self.config.camera_width)
164 cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, self.config.camera_height)
165 cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FPS, self.config.camera_fps)
166 logger.info(f"Connected to fallback camera: {fallback_source}")
167 return cap
168
169 cap.release()
170
171 logger.error("No camera sources available")
172 return None
173
174 except Exception as e:
175 logger.error(f"Failed to initialize video capture: {e}")
176 return None
177
178 def _initialize_tracker(self):
179 """Initialize the tracking system"""
180 try:
181 # Try DeepSort if enabled
182 if self.config.use_deepsort:
183 try:
184 from trackers import DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE
185 if DEEPSORT_AVAILABLE:
186 logger.info("Initializing DeepSort tracker")
187 self.tracker = DeepSortTracker(
188 max_age=self.config.max_age,
189 n_init=self.config.n_init
190 )
191 return
192 else:
193 logger.warning("DeepSort not available, using simple tracker")
194 except Exception as e:
195 logger.warning(f"Failed to initialize DeepSort: {e}, using simple tracker")
196
197 # Use simple tracker
198 logger.info("Using simple centroid tracker")
199 self.tracker = SimpleCentroidTracker(
200 max_age=self.config.max_age,
201 distance_threshold=self.config.centroid_distance_threshold
202 )
203
204 except Exception as e:
205 logger.error(f"Failed to initialize tracker: {e}")
206 self.tracker = SimpleCentroidTracker(max_age=self.config.max_age)
207
208 def _show_controls(self):
209 """Display control instructions"""
210 logger.info("\n" + "=" * 60)
211 logger.info("INTERACTIVE CONTROLS:")
212 logger.info("=" * 60)
213 for key, mode in self.display_modes.items():
214 logger.info(f" '{key}' - {mode}")
215 logger.info(" 'q' - Quit")
216 if self.config.enable_screenshots:
217 logger.info(" 's' - Save screenshot")
218 if self.config.enable_grid_adjustment:
219 logger.info(" 'g' - Toggle grid size")
220 logger.info(" 'r' - Reset to original grid")
221 logger.info(" 'f' - Show FPS info")
222 logger.info("=" * 60 + "\n")
223
224 def _process_video_stream(self, cap: cv2.VideoCapture):
225 """
226 Main video processing loop with interactive controls.
227 
228 Args:
229 cap: Video capture object
230 """
231 logger.info("Starting interactive video processing loop")
232
233 last_time = time.time()
234 show_fps = False
235
236 try:
237 while True:
238 ret, frame = cap.read()
239 if not ret:
240 logger.warning("Failed to read frame, ending processing")
241 break
242
243 self.frame_count += 1
244 current_time = time.time()
245 dt = current_time - last_time
246 last_time = current_time
247
248 # Update FPS tracking
249 self.fps_counter.append(current_time)
250 if len(self.fps_counter) > self.config.fps_counter_window:
251 self.fps_counter.pop(0)
252
253 # Process frame
254 tracks = self._process_frame(frame)
255
256 # Update occupancy grid (only for monitoring modes)
257 if self.current_mode in ['4', '5']:
258 self.occupancy_grid.update(tracks, dt)
259
260 # Generate visualization
261 display_frame = self._create_visualization(frame, tracks, show_fps)
262
263 # Display the frame
264 window_title = f"Enhanced Crowd Monitor - {self.display_modes[self.current_mode]}"
265 cv2.imshow(window_title, display_frame)
266
267 # Handle user input
268 key = cv2.waitKey(1) & 0xFF
269
270 if key == ord('q'):
271 logger.info("User requested quit")
272 break
273 elif key in [ord('1'), ord('2'), ord('3'), ord('4'), ord('5')]:
274 self._handle_mode_switch(chr(key))
275 elif key == ord('s') and self.config.enable_screenshots:
276 self._save_screenshot(display_frame)
277 elif key == ord('g') and self.config.enable_grid_adjustment:
278 self._toggle_grid_size()
279 elif key == ord('r'):
280 self._reset_grid_size()
281 elif key == ord('f'):
282 show_fps = not show_fps
283 logger.info(f"FPS display: {'ON' if show_fps else 'OFF'}")
284
285 except KeyboardInterrupt:
286 logger.info("Processing interrupted by user")
287 except Exception as e:
288 logger.error(f"Error in video processing loop: {e}")
289
290 def _process_frame(self, frame: np.ndarray) -> List[TrackData]:
291 """
292 Process a single frame for detections and tracking.
293 
294 Args:
295 frame: Input frame
296 
297 Returns:
298 List of current tracks
299 """
300 detections = []
301 if self.frame_count % self.config.detect_every == 0:
302 detections = self.detector.detect_persons(frame)
303 self.last_detection_frame = self.frame_count
304
305 if self.tracker is not None:
306 tracks = self.tracker.update_tracks(detections, frame)
307 return tracks
308 return []
309
310 def _create_visualization(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
311 show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
312 """
313 Create visualization based on current display mode.
314 
315 Args:
316 frame: Input frame
317 tracks: Current tracks
318 show_fps: Whether to show FPS
319 
320 Returns:
321 Visualization frame
322 """
323 if self.current_mode == '1': # Raw Camera
324 return self._create_raw_camera_view(frame, show_fps)
325 elif self.current_mode == '2': # Grid Overlay
326 return self._create_grid_overlay_view(frame, show_fps)
327 elif self.current_mode == '3': # Detection View
328 return self._create_detection_view(frame, tracks, show_fps)
329 elif self.current_mode == '4': # Monitoring View
330 return self._create_monitoring_view(frame, tracks, show_fps)
331 elif self.current_mode == '5': # Split View
332 return self._create_split_view(frame, tracks, show_fps)
333 else:
334 return frame
335
336 def _create_raw_camera_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
337 """Create raw camera view"""
338 view = frame.copy()
339 self.visualizer.add_basic_info_overlay(view, "Raw Camera", self.fps_counter,
340 self.fps_start_time, show_fps)
341 return view
342
343 def _create_grid_overlay_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
344 """Create camera view with grid overlay"""
345 view = frame.copy()
346 self.visualizer.draw_grid_overlay(view, self.calibrator.geometry_processor, self.occupancy_grid)
347 self.visualizer.add_basic_info_overlay(view, "Grid Overlay", self.fps_counter,
348 self.fps_start_time, show_fps)
349 return view
350
351 def _create_detection_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
352 show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
353 """Create detection view with bounding boxes"""
354 view = frame.copy()
355 for track in tracks:
356 self.visualizer.draw_simple_track_annotation(view, track)
357 info_text = f"People detected: {len(tracks)}"
358 cv2.putText(view, info_text, (10, 60), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.7, (0, 255, 0), 2)
359 self.visualizer.add_basic_info_overlay(view, "Detection View", self.fps_counter,
360 self.fps_start_time, show_fps)
361 return view
362
363 def _create_monitoring_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
364 show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
365 """Create full monitoring view with all features"""
366 view = frame.copy()
367 self.visualizer.draw_grid_overlay(view, self.calibrator.geometry_processor, self.occupancy_grid)
368 for track in tracks:
369 self.visualizer.draw_track_annotation(view, track, self.occupancy_grid)
370 self.visualizer.draw_cell_occupancy_overlay(view, self.calibrator.geometry_processor,
371 self.occupancy_grid)
372 info_panel = self.visualizer.create_info_panel(
373 view.shape[1], tracks, self.occupancy_grid, self.frame_count,
374 self.display_modes[self.current_mode], self.tracker, self.fps_counter,
375 self.fps_start_time, show_fps
376 )
377 view = np.vstack([view, info_panel])
378 return view
379
380 def _create_split_view(self, frame: np.ndarray, tracks: List[TrackData],
381 show_fps: bool) -> np.ndarray:
382 """Create split view showing multiple perspectives"""
383 small_height = self.camera_height // self.config.split_view_divisor
384 small_width = self.camera_width // self.config.split_view_divisor
385
386 raw_small = cv2.resize(self._create_raw_camera_view(frame, False), (small_width, small_height))
387 grid_small = cv2.resize(self._create_grid_overlay_view(frame, False), (small_width, small_height))
388 detection_small = cv2.resize(self._create_detection_view(frame, tracks, False),
389 (small_width, small_height))
390 birdseye_view = self.visualizer.create_birdseye_view(tracks, self.calibrator.geometry_processor,
391 self.occupancy_grid)
392 birdseye_small = cv2.resize(birdseye_view, (small_width, small_height))
393
394 cv2.putText(raw_small, "RAW CAMERA", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (255, 255, 255), 2)
395 cv2.putText(grid_small, "WITH GRID", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (0, 255, 0), 2)
396 cv2.putText(detection_small, "DETECTION", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (0, 255, 255), 2)
397 cv2.putText(birdseye_small, "BIRD'S EYE", (10, 25), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.6, (255, 0, 255), 2)
398
399 top_row = np.hstack([raw_small, grid_small])
400 bottom_row = np.hstack([detection_small, birdseye_small])
401 split_frame = np.vstack([top_row, bottom_row])
402
403 return split_frame
404
405 def _handle_mode_switch(self, new_mode: str):
406 """Handle display mode switch"""
407 old_mode = self.current_mode
408 self.current_mode = new_mode
409 mode_name = self.display_modes[self.current_mode]
410 logger.info(f"Display mode switched from {self.display_modes[old_mode]} to {mode_name}")
411
412 def _save_screenshot(self, frame: np.ndarray):
413 """Save screenshot to file"""
414 timestamp = time.strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
415 filename = f"crowd_monitor_{timestamp}.jpg"
416 cv2.imwrite(filename, frame)
417 logger.info(f"Screenshot saved: {filename}")
418
419 def _toggle_grid_size(self):
420 """Toggle between different grid sizes"""
421 current_cells = self.occupancy_grid.grid_rows * self.occupancy_grid.grid_cols
422
423 # Determine which multiplier to use based on thresholds
424 multiplier_index = 0
425 for threshold in self.config.grid_toggle_cell_thresholds:
426 if current_cells <= threshold:
427 multiplier_index += 1
428 break
429
430 if multiplier_index >= len(self.config.grid_toggle_multipliers):
431 multiplier_index = 0
432
433 multiplier = self.config.grid_toggle_multipliers[multiplier_index]
434 new_width = self.original_cell_width * multiplier
435 new_height = self.original_cell_height * multiplier
436
437 self.config.cell_width = new_width
438 self.config.cell_height = new_height
439 self.occupancy_grid.reinitialize(self.calibrator.world_width, self.calibrator.world_height)
440
441 def _reset_grid_size(self):
442 """Reset grid to original size"""
443 self.config.cell_width = self.original_cell_width
444 self.config.cell_height = self.original_cell_height
445 self.occupancy_grid.reinitialize(self.calibrator.world_width, self.calibrator.world_height)
446 logger.info("Grid reset to original size")

 2Main entry point for the Enhanced Crowd Monitoring System.
 3"""
 4
 5import argparse
 6import sys
 7
 8import cv2
 9
 10from config import MonitoringConfig
 11from logger_config import get_logger
 12from monitor import CrowdMonitor
 13
 14logger = get_logger(__name__)
 15
 16
 17def parse_arguments() -> MonitoringConfig:
 18 """
 19 Parse command line arguments and create configuration.
 20 
 21 Returns:
 22 Monitoring configuration object
 23 """
 24 parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
 25 description="Enhanced Crowd Monitoring System with Interactive Features",
 26 formatter_class=argparse.ArgumentDefaultsHelpFormatter
 27 )
 28
 29 # Video source and model
 30 parser.add_argument("--source", type=str, default="0",
 31 help="Video source (camera index or video file path)")
 32 parser.add_argument("--model", type=str, default="model/yolov8n.pt",
 33 help="YOLO model path")
 34
 35 # Spatial parameters
 36 parser.add_argument("--cell-width", type=float, default=2.0,
 37 help="Grid cell width in meters")
 38 parser.add_argument("--cell-height", type=float, default=2.0,
 39 help="Grid cell height in meters")
 40 parser.add_argument("--person-radius", type=float, default=2,
 41 help="Person radius for capacity calculation (meters)")
 42
 43 # Detection parameters
 44 parser.add_argument("--detect-every", type=int, default=3,
 45 help="Run detection every N frames")
 46 parser.add_argument("--conf", type=float, default=0.35,
 47 help="Detection confidence threshold")
 48 parser.add_argument("--min-bbox-area", type=int, default=1500,
 49 help="Minimum bounding box area")
 50
 51 # Tracking parameters
 52 parser.add_argument("--use-deepsort", action="store_true",
 53 help="Use DeepSort tracker (requires installation)")
 54 parser.add_argument("--max-age", type=int, default=30,
 55 help="Maximum age for tracks")
 56 parser.add_argument("--n-init", type=int, default=1,
 57 help="Number of frames to confirm track")
 58
 59 # Smoothing and alert settings
 60 parser.add_argument("--ema-alpha", type=float, default=0.4,
 61 help="EMA smoothing factor")
 62 parser.add_argument("--fps", type=float, default=15.0,
 63 help="Expected FPS for timing calculations")
 64 parser.add_argument("--hysteresis", type=float, default=3.0,
 65 help="Alert hysteresis time in seconds")
 66
 67 # Interactive features
 68 parser.add_argument("--disable-screenshots", action="store_true",
 69 help="Disable screenshot functionality")
 70 parser.add_argument("--disable-grid-adjustment", action="store_true",
 71 help="Disable runtime grid adjustment")
 72
 73 args = parser.parse_args()
 74
 75 # Create configuration object
 76 config = MonitoringConfig(
 77 source=args.source,
 78 model_path=args.model,
 79 cell_width=args.cell_width,
 80 cell_height=args.cell_height,
 81 person_radius=args.person_radius,
 82 detect_every=args.detect_every,
 83 confidence_threshold=args.conf,
 84 min_bbox_area=args.min_bbox_area,
 85 use_deepsort=args.use_deepsort,
 86 max_age=args.max_age,
 87 n_init=args.n_init,
 88 ema_alpha=args.ema_alpha,
 89 fps=args.fps,
 90 hysteresis_time=args.hysteresis,
 91 enable_screenshots=not args.disable_screenshots,
 92 enable_grid_adjustment=not args.disable_grid_adjustment
 93 )
 94
 95 return config
 96
 97
 98def main():
 99 """Main entry point"""
100 try:
101 # Parse configuration
102 config = parse_arguments()
103
104 logger.info("=== Enhanced Crowd Monitoring System ===")
105 logger.info(f"Video source: {config.source}")
106 logger.info(f"YOLO model: {config.model_path}")
107 logger.info(f"Grid cell size: {config.cell_width}x{config.cell_height}m")
108 logger.info(f"Person radius: {config.person_radius}m")
109 logger.info(f"Using tracker: {'DeepSort' if config.use_deepsort else 'Centroid'}")
110 logger.info(f"Interactive features: Screenshots={config.enable_screenshots}, "
111 f"Grid adjustment={config.enable_grid_adjustment}")
112
113 # Initialize and run monitoring system
114 monitor = CrowdMonitor(config)
115 success = monitor.initialize()
116
117 if success:
118 logger.info("Monitoring completed successfully")
119 else:
120 logger.error("Monitoring failed to initialize")
121 return 1
122
123 except KeyboardInterrupt:
124 logger.info("System interrupted by user")
125 return 0
126 except Exception as e:
127 logger.error(f"System error: {e}")
128 return 1
129 finally:
130 # Cleanup
131 try:
132 cv2.destroyAllWindows()
133 except Exception:
134 pass
135
136 return 0
137
138
139if __name__ == "__main__":
140 sys.exit(main())

\n def _set_widget_value(self, key: str, value: Any):\n \"\"\"Set widget value based on widget type\"\"\"\n if key not in self.config_widgets:\n return\n \n widget = self.config_widgets[key]\n \n if isinstance(widget, tk.BooleanVar):\n widget.set(value)\n elif isinstance(widget, (ttk.Entry, ttk.Spinbox, ttk.Combobox)):\n widget.delete(0, tk.END)\n widget.insert(0, str(value))\n elif isinstance(widget, ttk.Scale):\n widget.set(value)\n \n def _get_widget_value(self, key: str) -> Any:\n \"\"\"Get value from widget based on widget type\"\"\"\n if key not in self.config_widgets:\n return None\n \n widget = self.config_widgets[key]\n \n if isinstance(widget, tk.BooleanVar):\n return widget.get()\n elif isinstance(widget, (ttk.Entry, ttk.Spinbox, ttk.Combobox)):\n return widget.get()\n elif isinstance(widget, ttk.Scale):\n return widget.get()\n \n def _collect_config_from_ui(self) -> MonitoringConfig:\n \"\"\"Collect configuration from UI widgets\"\"\"\n # Helper to convert values\n def to_int(val):\n try:\n return int(float(val))\n except:\n return 0\n \n def to_float(val):\n try:\n return float(val)\n except:\n return 0.0\n \n source = self._get_widget_value('source')\n \n config = MonitoringConfig(\n # Video\n source=source,\n model_path=self._get_widget_value('model_path'),\n camera_width=to_int(self._get_widget_value('camera_width')),\n camera_height=to_int(self._get_widget_value('camera_height')),\n camera_fps=to_int(self._get_widget_value('camera_fps')),\n \n # Grid\n cell_width=to_float(self._get_widget_value('cell_width')),\n cell_height=to_float(self._get_widget_value('cell_height')),\n person_radius=to_float(self._get_widget_value('person_radius')),\n \n # Detection\n detect_every=to_int(self._get_widget_value('detect_every')),\n confidence_threshold=to_float(self._get_widget_value('confidence_threshold')),\n min_bbox_area=to_int(self._get_widget_value('min_bbox_area')),\n yolo_imgsz=to_int(self._get_widget_value('yolo_imgsz')),\n \n # Tracking\n use_deepsort=self._get_widget_value('use_deepsort'),\n max_age=to_int(self._get_widget_value('max_age')),\n n_init=to_int(self._get_widget_value('n_init')),\n centroid_distance_threshold=to_float(self._get_widget_value('centroid_distance_threshold')),\n \n # Smoothing\n ema_alpha=to_float(self._get_widget_value('ema_alpha')),\n fps=to_float(self._get_widget_value('fps')),\n hysteresis_time=to_float(self._get_widget_value('hysteresis_time')),\n alert_clear_offset=to_float(self._get_widget_value('alert_clear_offset')),\n occupancy_warning_threshold=to_float(self._get_widget_value('occupancy_warning_threshold')),\n \n # Visualization\n max_birdseye_pixels=to_int(self._get_widget_value('max_birdseye_pixels')),\n grid_line_thickness=to_int(self._get_widget_value('grid_line_thickness')),\n font_size_large=to_float(self._get_widget_value('font_size_large')),\n font_size_medium=to_float(self._get_widget_value('font_size_medium')),\n font_size_birdseye=to_float(self._get_widget_value('font_size_birdseye')),\n \n # Interactive\n enable_screenshots=self._get_widget_value('enable_screenshots'),\n enable_grid_adjustment=self._get_widget_value('enable_grid_adjustment'),\n fps_counter_window=to_int(self._get_widget_value('fps_counter_window')),\n
